subject: Tennis
lead_paragraph: Roger Federer, stuck in a slump, said on his Web site that he would work with a new coach, José Higueras, at the Estoril Open in Portugal this week. Federer begins the European clay-court season having failed to reach a final in four tournaments this year. Higueras is a clay-court specialist who coached a teenage Michael Chang to the 1989 French Open title. Federer has worked without a coach since splitting with Tony Roche last May.
